aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: The aspect provides the information in which parent part(s)/product(s)the given item is to be assembled into or used. This could be a 1:1 relationship in terms of a e.g. a brake component or 1:n for e.g. coatings. The given item as well as the parent item must refer to an object from the as-planned lifecycle phase. If multiple versions of parent parts exist that the child part can be assembled into or used, all versions of the parent part are included in the usage list.
Set of parent parts, in which the given child object will be assembled into or used (one structural level up).
Catena-X ID and meta data of the parent part.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
If a validity period only has a start that means that the period is valid from the start date without a (yet)defined enddate and vice versa.
A list of all customers of this item. If the parent items in which this item will be assembled into or used are known, they should be listed as well.

The aspect provides the information in which parent part(s)/product(s)the given item is to be assembled into or used. This could be a 1:1 relationship in terms of a e.g. a brake component or 1:n for e.g. coatings. The given item as well as the parent item must refer to an object from the as-planned lifecycle phase. If multiple versions of parent parts exist that the child part can be assembled into or used, all versions of the parent part are included in the usage list.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: The aspect provides the information in which parent part(s)/product(s)the given item is to be assembled into or used. This could be a 1:1 relationship in terms of a e.g. a brake component or 1:n for e.g. coatings. The given item as well as the parent item must refer to an object from the as-planned lifecycle phase. If multiple versions of parent parts exist that the child part can be assembled into or used, all versions of the parent part are included in the usage list.
The Catena-X ID of the given part (e.g. the component), valid for the Catena-X dataspace.
Timestamp when the relation between the parent part and the child part was created.
The quantity value associated with the unit.
The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.
Quantity of which the child part will be assembled into or used in the parent part.
Timestamp when the assembly or usage relationship between parent part and child part was last modified.

The period of time during which the parent-child relation is valid. This relates to whether a child part can be built into or used in the production of the parent part at a given time. If no validity period is given the relation is considered valid at any point in time.
The supplier of the given child item.
The Catena-X ID of the given part (e.g. the component), valid for the Catena-X dataspace.
Set of parent parts, in which the given child object will be assembled into or used (one structural level up).
A list of all customers of this item. If the parent items in which this item will be assembled into or used are known, they should be listed as well.
